title: Pearl Jam Studio Albums
description: Pearl Jam became an American rock institution by broadening their heavy, Led Zeppelin-influenced sound while maintaining the emotional depth that made their songs so resonant in the first place. This quest is sorted by album release date.

questEntries.title: Ten
questEntries.description: Pearl Jam debuted with Ten, their most accessible, least self-conscious album.

questEntries.title: Vs.
questEntries.description: Vs. features a rawer and more aggressive sound compared with the band's previous release.

questEntries.title: Vitalogy
questEntries.description: The music on the record was more diverse than previous releases, and consists of aggressive rock songs, ballads and other elements making this Pearl Jam's first experimental album

questEntries.title: No Code
questEntries.description: The music on the record was more diverse than what the band had done on previous releases, incorporating elements of garage rock and worldbeat.

questEntries.title: Yield
questEntries.description: The lyrics deal with contemplative themes, albeit seen in a more positive manner compared to the band's earlier work.

questEntries.title: Binaural
questEntries.description: The music on the record featured an experimental sound, evident on songs that used binaural recording techniques.

questEntries.title: Riot Act
questEntries.description: The music on the record featured a diverse sound, including songs influenced by folk, art rock, and experimental rock.

questEntries.title: Pearl Jam
questEntries.description: The music on the record was proclaimed as a return to the band's roots, with an emphasis on up-tempo songs with an aggressive sound.

questEntries.title: Backspacer
questEntries.description: The music on the album—the shortest of the band's career—features a sound influenced by pop and new wave.

questEntries.title: Lightning Bolt
questEntries.description: The music for Lightning Bolt has a harder rock sound with longer songs to contrast predecessor Backspacer.
